meanings.definition: To give incorrect advice or guidance.
meanings.sent1: She was misadvising her friend on the best route to take.
meanings.sent2: He kept misadvising his sister on how to solve the math problem.
meanings.sent3: The misadvising parrot told the cat to swim in the fish tank.
meanings.sent4: The misadvising compass led the hikers deeper into the forest.
meanings.sent5: Misadvising can lead to confusion and mistakes.

meanings.definition: To offer poor or misguided counsel.
meanings.sent1: The travel agent was misadvising the tourists on the local customs.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was misadvising the students on the importance of studying.
meanings.sent3: The misadvising fortune teller predicted rain on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The misadvising map sent the explorers in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent5: Misadvising can have serious consequences on people's decisions.
